    • Method Detail

      • plural

        public static String plural​(String noun,
                            Map<?,​?> m)
        Deprecated.
        Really basic method for creating the plural of a noun. Useful as a static import in the message argument list of a log message, or within the argument list of String.format. Returns the unchanged noun if the map's size is 1, else the plural of the noun. See plural(String, int).
        Parameters:
        noun -
        m -
        Returns:

      • plural

        public static String plural​(String noun,
                            Collection<?> c)
        Deprecated.
        Really basic method for creating the plural of a noun. Useful as a static import in the message argument list of a log message, or within the argument list of String.format. Returns the unchanged noun if the collection's size is 1, else the plural of the noun. See plural(String, int).
        Parameters:
        noun -
        c -
        Returns:

      • plural

        public static String plural​(String noun,
                            int count)
        Deprecated.
        Really basic method for creating the plural of a noun. Useful as a static import in the message argument list of a log message, or within the argument list of String.format. Returns the unchanged noun if the provided integer is 1, else the plural of the noun. There is no linguistic sophistication in the generation of the plural and it's only useful for English messages.

        Examples:

        country countries
        default defaults
        Parameters:
        noun -
        count -
        Returns:
